We can't forget - even if we tried - but we can move on knowing that holding descendants accountable for the sins of their fathers Â is unhealthy for both sides of atrocities.

In his mind, he was continuing/justifying holy wars against invading infidels - centuries hence.Â Atrocities beget atrocities : Russian troops in WW2 raped German women in revenge for Hitler's earlier atrocities against Russians on the Eastern Front. German prisoners of war were released only as late as the 1950s - after a majority had died in imprisonment.
In policing the world for democracy, US troops - as human as others - committed atrocities against unarmed/fleeing Korean refugees in No Gun Ri during the Korean War. Again, in My Lai, when some soldiers massacred unarmed villagers during the Vietnam War.
ThatÂ Nazi troops had murderedÂ captured US troops in Cold blood - during the Battle of the Bulge in WW2 - can't justify US atrocities, right?Â Atrocities continue. The latest being Panjwai in Afghanistan whenÂ a rogue Staff Sgt BalesÂ - some claim not Acting alone -Â massacredÂ unarmed/innocent women and children.Â
It's not the scale of massacres that's evil - every atrocity IS, including Hiroshima and Nagasaki. No human is exempt from doing/suffering evil. It's the nature of our beast to be unjust - some of us, at times - whether killing innocents or whatever.Â
